intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. oligandromorphus, commonly known as the lesser buttercup, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers and trifoliate leaves. The subspecies is distinguished by its smaller flower size and fewer花瓣 compared to the typical form of Ranunculus auricomus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant is often found in temperate regions and is part of the Ranunculaceae family.
